news.title: RTÉ to hold another redundancy round next year, Kevin Bakhurst tells TDs
Storm Bram: Met Éireann issues new wind warning for three counties, as 8,000 remain without power
news.summary: Forecasters have issued a fresh wind warning for three counties as the Storm Bram recovery and clean-up continues.

news.title: ‘I didn’t do anything to the doors, Ted’ – ‘Father Jack’ landlord is ordered to refund €891 of deposit to tenant over painting row
news.summary: A landlord who accused a tenant of “making a mess” painting a property has been ordered to refund €891 of her deposit after it had been withheld.

news.title: Mystery over €357k seized from double killer’s home continues as Cab drop out of probe
news.summary: The Criminal Assets Bureau (Cab) are no longer involved in the investigation into the origins of €357,000 in cash that was seized by gardaí during a search of the family home of double murderer Yousef Palani.

news.title: A long way from Paradise: Roma indicate they are ready to call time on Evan Ferguson loan ahead of Parkhead trip
news.summary: Like any footballer in any league right now, if Evan Ferguson was asked how he thought he was doing and what his hopes for the future were, he’d reply with, “I’m just taking it game by game”.

news.title: Deirdre Reynolds: When it comes to Christmas gifts, I’m with Roy Keane – they are only for kids
news.summary: Amid the annual Christmas shopping lunacy, I’m with Roy Keane, who famously once said adults shouldn’t get gifts.

news.title: Eoin McGee answers: ‘We have €113k and 10 years left on our mortgage. What’s the quickest way to get rid of it?’
Money Talks: How to ‘fight better’ at Christmas when it comes to money-related rows
news.summary: Christmas Day is just around the corner and while we’re all looking forward to the big event, this time of year presents its own unique stresses.

news.title: John Downing: From ‘fón póca’ to ‘burrito’ – new Irish dictionary is a milestone in revival of our native language
news.summary: Many people like me, who live a large chunk of every-day life speaking Irish, also drink cappuccinos and lattes, eat kebabs and burritos and use phrases like ad hoc.

news.title: US plans to ask all tourists – including from Ireland – to share five years of social media history
news.summary: All tourists, whether they require a visa or not, may have to undergo social media screenings to enter the US.
